text:
[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Description
Arduino® Braccio Carrier is an add-on board that sits on top of your favorite Arduino educational existing product line providing faster prototyping in increasing demands for robotics and automation. The tailor-made Braccio Carrier has a collection of features that enables quick and easy learning while building small projects.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Features
- MaxLinear SP335 Transceiver
- Multiprotocol transceiver supporting RS-232, RS-485, and RS-422 serial standards
- Data rates of 20 Mbps in RS-485/422 modes and up to 1Mbps in RS-232
- ±15kV ESD protection
- Supply voltage from 3V to 5.5V
- Display Connector
- Flexible flat cable and flexible printed circuit connector with 0.5mm spacing
- Operating temperature up to 105°C
- Max current for one contact is 0.5A
- Robust, reliable and easy to operate for automatic mounting and SMT processes
- Right angle mounting
- Plastic tape packaging
- Mini Joystick Connector
- Programmable USB Type-C® Connector
- ESD Protection
- 4- and 5-line unidirectional transil function for electrostatic discharge protection
- Low-leakage current: < 500 nA
- PCB Area: < 2.6 mm2

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

1 The Board
The custom-made Braccio Carrier provides a wide range of connectivity capabilities to the Arduino educational boards. For easy to learn and play around prototyping robotic and smart automation projects in and out of classrooms, Braccio Carrier features interfaces for display, servo motors and joystick. Along with high-speed RS485/422 and RS-232 serial communication, the carrier offers huge support for several accessories through the IO headers. In situations of long-range operations, RS-485 can support several devices on the same bus in a noisy environment. The carrier has robust electrostatic discharge protection circuitry to keep the components safe.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

1.1 Application Examples
- Smart Automation : The industry-standard RS-232 and RS-485/422 serial communication support for Braccio Carrier has made it possible to implement smart automation IoT projects for a wide range of projects. The lowpower carrier board enables students to take advantage of the onboard connectors and play with the Arduino hardware for the enhanced learning experience.
- Robotic Arm : Through servo motor connector supporting up to a total of 6 motors has given a chance to demonstrate robotic application including RC Car. Some of the most interesting robotic applications with faster prototyping come from the student community for various problem statements.
- Gaming : Thanks to the Mini Joystick connector provided on the Braccio Carrier carrier board which facilitates the implementation of LCD gaming options. Interfacing Mini Joystick with the carrier board integrated with a powerful Arduino board can deliver some really exciting projects.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

JAX133T-IF05
- Display module to allow Braccio ++ to deploy visual information. The module is based on 240RGBX240 DotMatrix TFT LCD via FPC interface. It is possible to interconnect via Display Connector J1 found on Arduino® Braccio Carrier.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Switronic IT-1501-G
- Joystick module to allow Braccio ++ manoeuvre. It is possible to interconnect via J3 & J4 Board Connector found on Braccio Carrier.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Display Connector J1
- Connector available to interface the JAX133T-IF05 display module.
J1, Maximum Electrical Operating Range = 0.5A per Contact. J1, Maximum Temperature Operating Range = 105 °C

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

J3 & J4 Board Connector
- Board splitter which allows to interface display and joystick at a distance, from which all the motor wire interfaces arrive.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

- Rectangular power connector with 6 contacts. Available for external power supply and for servo line.
2, Maximum Electrical Operating Range = 600V @8.5A. 2, Maximum Temperature Operating Range = -40 °C ~ +105 °C

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Adam Equipment LHA-04-TS
- Connectors available to interface with motors. RS485 smart motors compatible, derived by configuration of 4x SR418D and 2x SR312 models. Lead free and RoHS Compliant.
6, Maximum Electrical Operating Range = 250VAC@3A. 6, Maximum Temperature Operating Range = -25 °C ~ +85 °C

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

USB-C® Port
- USB Type-C® port available to enable programming, and power supply source port under USB PD 3.0 for Braccio Carrier.
3.1, USB Power Delivery Rev. = 3.0. 3.1, USB Type = Type C (Reversible). 3.1, Purpose = Power Supply

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

ESLOV Connector
- The connector provides the capability of module's automatic configuration and handle the sleep state for low power mode. Connector is designated with J2 reference, providing 5 pins for interrupt and I2C protocol at 5V.
J2, Operating Voltage = 5V. J2, Line Feature = I2C Protocol + Interrupt

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

3.1 Recommended Operating Conditions
Conservative thermal limits for the whole board:, Min = -40 °C. Conservative thermal limits for the whole board:, Max = 85 °C

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

4.1 Block Diagram
Arduino Braccio Carrier System Block Diagram
The USB powers the Arduino® Nano RP2040 Connect which is the heart of the Braccio Carrier as it stores the programs responsible for the functioning of the whole system. The Nano is connected to the joystick which is the input peripheral and LED display screen which is the output peripheral of the microcontroller. Another power supply via USB-C® powers the connected motors which constitute the entire robotics functionality the system. RS485 Transceiver signals the motor connector for the precise motihe motors according to the input given by the user.
Arduino Braccio Carrier Block Diagram

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

4.2 Board Topology
Arduino Braccio Carrier Top View
PB1, Description = Pushbutton SMD. PB1, Ref. = PB2. PB1, Description = Mini Joystick. U1, Description = 24 Bit I2C SMBUS I/O. U1, Ref. = U4. U1, Description = Line Transceiver. J1, Description = CONN FPC SMD. J1, Ref. = J2. J1, Description = CONN JST 5 POS. J3, Description = Board Connector. J3, Ref. = J4. J3, Description = Board Connector. U3, Description = Power Supply Support Circuit. U3, Ref. = J8. U3, Description = USB 3.1 Type C (USB PD 3.0)

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

4.3 Processor
Primary processor of Braccio Carrier is the processor of the Nano RP2040 Connect microcontroller mounted on it. The microcontroller controls every operation of the Braccio Carrier for the target applications via connections with motors and LED display screen.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

5.1 Getting Started - IDE
If you want to program your Braccio Carrier while offline you need to install the Arduino Desktop IDE [1] To connect the Braccio Carrier to your computer, you'll need a Type-B USB cable. This also provides power to the board, as indicated by the LED.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

5.3 Online Resources
Now that you have gone through the basics of what you can do with the board you can explore the endless possibilities it provides by checking exciting projects on Project Hub [2] , the Arduino Library Reference [3] and the online store [4] where you will be able to complement your board with sensors, actuators and more.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

5.4 Board Recovery
All Arduino boards have a built-in bootloader which allows flashing the board via USB. In case a sketch locks up the processor and the board is not reachable anymore via USB it is possible to enter bootloader mode by doubletapping the reset button right after power up.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Poly Brominated Biphenyls (PBB), Maximum Limit (ppm) = 1000. Poly Brominated Diphenyl ethers (PBDE), Maximum Limit (ppm) = 1000. Bis(2-Ethylhexyl} phthalate (DEHP), Maximum Limit (ppm) = 1000. Arduino® Boards are fully compliant with the related requirements of European Union Regulation (EC) 1907 /2006 concerning the Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH). We declare none of the SVHCs (https://echa.europa.eu/web/guest/candidate-list-table), the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorization currently released by ECHA, is present in all products (and also package) in quantities totaling in a concentration equal or above 0.1%. To the best of our knowledge, we also declare that our products do not contain any of the substances listed on the "Authorization List" (Annex XIV of the REACH regulations) and Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) in any significant amounts as specified by the Annex XVII of Candidate list published by ECHA (European Chemical Agency) 1907 /2006/EC.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

8.3 Conflict Minerals Declaration
As a global supplier of electronic and electrical components, Arduino® is aware of our obligations with regards to laws and regulations regarding Conflict Minerals, specifically the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, Section 1502. Arduino® does not directly source or process conflict minerals such as Tin, Tantalum, Tungsten, or Gold. Conflict minerals are contained in our products in the form of solder, or as a component in metal alloys. As part of our reasonable due diligence Arduino® has contacted component suppliers within our supply chain to verify their continued compliance with the regulations. Based on the information received thus far we declare that our products contain Conflict Minerals sourced from conflict-free areas.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

Any Changes or modifications not expressly approved by the party responsible for compliance could void the user's authority to operate the equipment.

- (2) this device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

3. This equipment should be installed and operated with minimum distance 20cm between the radiator & your body.

This device complies with Industry Canada license-exempt RSS standard(s). Operation is subject to the following two conditions:

[Product: Braccio Carrier] [Category: Education]

2400-2483.5 Mhz, Maximum output power (ERP) = 17 dBm

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

Description
The Arduino® DIN Celsius offers you a mini temperature laboratory to test your PLC skills, with two independent heater circuits and one temperature sensor placed at the center of the board.

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

Features
Note : This board needs the Arduino Opta® for full functionality.
- Temperature sensor
- 1 TMP236, from -10 °C to 125 °C with an accuracy of +/- 2.5 °C
- Heater circuits
- 2 independent heater circuits
- Screw connectors
- 2 screw connectors exposing +24V DC
- 2 screw connectors exposing GND
- 2 screw connectors for the two independent heater circuits (24 V)
- 1 screw connector for the output voltage of the temperature sensor
- DIN mounting
- RT-072 DIN Rail Modular PCB Board Holders - 72 mm

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

1 Functional Overview
These are the main components of the board, other secondary components, i.e. resistors or capacitors, are not listed.
1, Function = temperature sensor. 1, Description = TMP236A2DBZR IC SENSOR. 4, Function = left heating circuit. 4, Description = RES CHIP 1210 1k2 1% 1/2W. 4, Function = right heating circuit. 4, Description = RES CHIP 1210 1k2 1% 1/2W. 2, Function = heating status. 2, Description = LED SMD 0603 RED. 1, Function = power status. 1, Description = LED SMD 0603 GREEN. 1, Function = power connector. 1, Description = CONN SCREW TERMINAL, pitch 5mm, 4POS, 16A, 450V, 2.5mm 2. 1, Function = input / output connectors. 1, Description = CONN SCREW TERMINAL, pitch 5mm, 3POS, 16A, 450V, 2.5mm 2. 1, Function = protect from reverse polarity. 1, Description = DIODE SCHOTTKY SMD 2A 60V SOD123FL

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

2 Heating Circuits
The board provides two independent heating circuits powered by 24 V through two different screw connector, one placed on the left side of the temperature sensor and the other on the right side. You can see how it works in the following image:
heater
The heat is generated by the current passing through four resistors in series, and the power is about 120 mW per circuits.
toggle switch scheme

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

3 Temperature Sensor
The temperature sensor is the TMP236A2DBZR from Texas Instruments, here you can find the datasheet of the component, look for the TMP236 and not TMP235. Here you can see its main characteristc:
- analog out 19. 5mV/°C
- accuracy max +-2.5 °C
In order to create an analog output signal (0 - 10 V) a 4.9 multiplier circuits has been added before the OUTPUT VOLTAGE screw connector pin.
The relation between the temperature, the voltage of the sensor and the output voltage of the board is summarized in the following table:
-10, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,2. -10, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 1,0. -5, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,3. -5, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 1,5. 0, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,4. 0, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 2,0. 5, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,5. 5, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 2,4. 10, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,6. 10, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 2,9. 15, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,7. 15, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 3,4. 20, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,8. 20, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 3,9. 25, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 0,9. 25, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 4,4. 30, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,0. 30, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 4,8. 35, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,1. 35, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 5,3. 40, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,2. 40, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 5,8. 45, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,3. 45, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 6,3. 50, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,4. 50, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 6,7. 55, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,5. 55, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 7,2. 60, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,6. 60, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 7,7. 65, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,7. 65, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 8,2. 70, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,8. 70, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 8,6. 75, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 1,9. 75, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 9,1. 80, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 2,0. 80, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 9,6. 85, SENSOR OUTPUT [V] = 2,1. 85, BOARD OUTPUT x4,9 [V] = 10,1

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

4 Hello, My Name is:
At the bottom right of the board a white rectangle on the silk layer offer a space to customize the board with your name.
name space

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

5 Compatible Boards
Arduino Opta® RS485, SKU = AFX00001. Arduino Opta® RS485, Min voltage = 12 V. Arduino Opta® RS485, Max voltage = 24 V. Arduino Opta® WiFi, SKU = AFX00002. Arduino Opta® WiFi, Min voltage = 12 V. Arduino Opta® WiFi, Max voltage = 24 V. Arduino Opta® Lite, SKU = AFX00003. Arduino Opta® Lite, Min voltage = 12 V. Arduino Opta® Lite, Max voltage = 24 V. Arduino® Portenta Machine Control, SKU = AKX00032. Arduino® Portenta Machine Control, Min voltage = 24 V. Arduino® Portenta Machine Control, Max voltage = 24 V. Arduino® DIN Simul8, SKU = ABX00097. Arduino® DIN Simul8, Min voltage = 24 V. Arduino® DIN Simul8, Max voltage = 24 V
Note: Please turn to each board's datasheet for further information about power and their capacity.

[Product: DIN Celsius] [Category: Education]

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

Description
Arduino® DIN Simul8 is a digital-input-simulator and power distribution board for the Arduino Opta® family and Arduino® PLC Starter Kit. It provides eight toggle switches (0 - 10 V output) and four screw terminal for bringing the 24 V and the GROUND easily to the PLC or other board.

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

Features
Note : This board needs the Arduino Opta® for full functionality.
- Toggle Switches
- 8 toggle switch in the middle of the board
- LEDs
- 8 leds showing the status of each toggle switches
- Screw connectors
- 2 screw connectors exposing +24 V DC
- 2 screw connectors exposing GND
- 8 screw connectors link to the toggle switches output (0 - 10 V)
- 1 barrel plug (+24 V DC)
- DIN mounting
- RT-072 DIN Rail Modular PCB Board Holders - 72 mm

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

1 Functional Overview
These are the main components of the board, other secondary components, i.e. resistors, are not listed.
8, Function = 0 - 10 V signal output. 8, Description = Switch toggle SPST handle 6.1 mmbushing SPST terminal type M2 contact silver, color black. 8, Function = show switch status. 8, Description = LED SMD 0603 GIA588 8mcd 120^. 1, Function = power plug. 1, Description = CONN PWR JACK 2.1X5.5 mmSOLDER. 1, Function = show main power status. 1, Description = LED SMD 0603 GREEN/568 15mcd 120^. 1, Function = power connector. 1, Description = CONN SCREW TERMINAL, pitch 5 mm, 4POS, 16 A, 450 V, 2.5mm 2 14AWG, dovetail, GREY, screw flat, housing 20x16.8x8.9mm. 1, Function = signal connector. 1, Description = CONN SCREW TERMINAL, pitch 5 mm, 8POS, 16 A, 450 V, 2.5mm 2 14AWG, dovetail, GREY, screw flat, housing 40x16.8x8.9mm. 1, Function = protect from reverse polarity. 1, Description = DIODE SCHOTTKY SMD 2 A 60 V SOD123FL

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

2 Power Distribution
The board can be powered up from the barrel plug and then offer two couple of screw connector to deliver power to the PLC and other board, i.e. the Arduino® DIN Celsius board of the PLC Starter Kit.
power distribution
power distribution scheme

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

3 Deliver 8 Signal 0-10 V with Toggle Switch
Once powered up, every toggle-switch drive a 0-10 V signal:
- 0 V when it's in is OFF position: toward the barrel plug
- around 10 V when it's in its ON position: toward the screw connector
as shown in the following images:
toggle switch
toggle switch scheme

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

4 Hello, My Name is:
At the bottom right of the board a white rectangle on the silk layer offer a space to customize the board with your name.
name space

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

Note: Please turn to each board's datasheet for further information about power and their capacity.

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

To the best of our knowledge, we also declare that our products do not contain any of the substances listed on the "Authorization List" (Annex XIV of the REACH regulations) and Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) in any significant amounts as specified by the Annex XVII of Candidate list published by ECHA (European Chemical Agency) 1907 /2006/EC.

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

7.3 Conflict Minerals Declaration
As a global supplier of electronic and electrical components, Arduino is aware of our obligations with regards to laws and regulations regarding Conflict Minerals, specifically the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, Section 1502. Arduino does not directly source or process conflict minerals such as Tin, Tantalum, Tungsten, or Gold. Conflict minerals are contained in our products in the form of solder, or as a component in metal alloys. As part of our reasonable due diligence Arduino has contacted component suppliers within our supply chain to verify their continued compliance with the regulations. Based on the information received thus far we declare that our products contain Conflict Minerals sourced from conflict-free areas.

[Product: DIN Simul8] [Category: Education]

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

Description
Arduino® Alvik is a powerful and versatile robot specifically designed for programming and STEAM education.
Powered by the Arduino® Nano ESP32, Alvik offers diverse learning paths through different programming languages including MicroPython, the Arduino language, and block-based coding; enabling different possibilities to explore Robotics, IoT and AI.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.1 General Specifications Overview
Alvik is an educational robot that is battery-powered and has multiple sensors and actuators, like color detection, distance, line following, accelerometer, gyroscope and much more.
Alvik's Main Components
Alvik on-board Core, Description = STM32 Arm® Cortex®-M4 32 Bit. Alvik Main Controller, Description = Arduino® Nano ESP32. Connectivity, Description = Wi-Fi®, Bluetooth® LE. Sensors, Description = RGB Color detection, Distance ToF 8x8 Array - up to 350 cm, IMU - 6 degree, 3x Line follower, 7x Touch sensor. Motors, Description = High precision with hall effect encoder. Up to 13 cm/s. Extensions, Description = Servo motor, I2C Grove, Qwiic, Lego® Technic™, M3x5 mmScrews

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.3 Controllers
Alvik comes with two main microcontrollers:
- At the core of the robot there is the STM32 Arm® Cortex®-M4 that controls all the sensors and actuators.
- At the top a Nano ESP32 acts like the main controller and can communicate with the STM32 through a set of dedicated APIs.
STM32F411RC, Product page = Link. STM32F411RC, Datasheet = Link. Arduino® Nano ESP32, Product page = Link. Arduino® Nano ESP32, Datasheet = Link

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.4 Sensors
Alvik comes with a large number of onboard sensors, from color detection to distance sensors or inertial measurement units, all of which are listed in the following table:
Color detection (x1), Part Name = APDS 9660. Color detection (x1), Product page = Link. Color detection (x1), Datasheet = Link. IMU (x1), Part Name = LSM6DSOX. IMU (x1), Product page = Link. IMU (x1), Datasheet = Link. Time of Flight distance sensor (x1), Part Name = VL53L7CXV0GC. Time of Flight distance sensor (x1), Product page = Link. Time of Flight distance sensor (x1), Datasheet = Link. Line Follower Array (x3), Part Name = Custom made. Line Follower Array (x3), Product page = -. Line Follower Array (x3), Datasheet = -. Capacitive Touch buttons (x7), Part Name = Custom made. Capacitive Touch buttons (x7), Product page = -. Capacitive Touch buttons (x7), Datasheet = -
The sensory capabilities of Alvik can be expanded using the different connectors and communication protocols available at the back of the robot.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.5 Actuators
Alvik has as actuators two DC motors with magnetic relative encoders and two RGB LEDs that can be used for different purposes. In addition to that it is possible to expand the capabilities of Alvik by adding new actuators using the different connectors and communication protocols available at the back of the robot.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.5.1 Motors
Alvik is a differential robot driven by two independent DC motors with magnetic relative encoders:
Alvik's DC Motor Technical Specs
The motors have the following technical specifications:
Operating Voltage, Information = 6 VDC. No load Current, Information = 70 mA. Max load Current, Information = 90 mA. No load Speed, Information = 96 rpm. Magnetic relative AB encoder, Information = 3 ppr
The two motors are driven by the MAX22211 motors driver:
Dual Motor Driver, Part Name = MAX22211. Dual Motor Driver, Product page = Link. Dual Motor Driver, Datasheet = Link

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.5.2 RGB LEDs
Alvik has two fully programmable RGB LEDs named DL1 and DL2 at its top.
RGB LED Left, Information = DL1. RGB LED Right, Information = DL2

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

1.6 Connectors & Communication Protocols
The robot is compatible with the following communication protocols:
I2C, Information = Groove and Qwiic connector. PWMServomotor Control (x2), Information = Servo Motor connector
The connectors are placed in the back of the robot, the pinout is shown in the following image:
Connectors pinout

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.1 Topology
The main parts of the robot are the following:
Alvik's main part from top to bottom (left) and bottom to top (right)
Arduino® Nano ESP32, Quantity = 1. Arduino® Nano ESP32, Details = Main controller of the robot. Main PCB, Quantity = 1. Main PCB, Details = Main PCB of the robot. STM32 Arm® Cortex®-M4 32 Bit, Quantity = 1. STM32 Arm® Cortex®-M4 32 Bit, Details = Onboard STM32 auxiliary controller. Touch Programmable button, Quantity = 7. Touch Programmable button, Details = Touch programmable buttons integrated on the main PCB. ON/OFF Power Switch, Quantity = 1. ON/OFF Power Switch, Details = Assembled on the main PCB. RGB LED, Quantity = 2. RGB LED, Details = Fully programmable RGB LED mounted on the main PCB. Color Sensor, Quantity = 1. Color Sensor, Details = RGB Color detector. 6-Axis Gyro/Accelerometer, Quantity = 1. 6-Axis Gyro/Accelerometer, Details = 6-Axis Gyro and Accelerometer sensor. Front PCB, Quantity = 1. Front PCB, Details = Robot auxiliary PCB with additional sensors. ToF Distance Sensor, Quantity = 1. ToF Distance Sensor, Details = Time-of-Flight Distance sensor up to 350 cm , mounted on the Front PCB. Line follower array, Quantity = 1. Line follower array, Details = Line follower array made up of 3 phototransistors and 4 infrared LEDs, mounted on the front PCB. Grove Connector, Quantity = 2. Grove Connector, Details = I2C Grove Connector to extend robot's capabilities

Main Chassis, Details = Main chassis of the robot made in plastic. Motor holder, Quantity = 2. Motor holder, Details = Plastic support to hold the motor in place, a screwdriver is required to open it. Motors, Quantity = 2. Motors, Details = DC Motor with magnetic relative encoder. Rubber wheel, Quantity = 2. Rubber wheel, Details = Rubber wheel with 34 mmof diameter. Inox steal ball9mm, Quantity = 1. Inox steal ball9mm, Details = Ball that serves as third support for stability. Ball caster holder, Quantity = 1. Ball caster holder, Details = Plastic support to hold the steal ball. [Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.3 Power Supply
The power distribution in the robot is explained by the following diagram:
Power Tree Diagram
There are three levels of power inside the robot:
+3V7, Description = From the battery, the reference level is 3.7 V but it can goes from 3.0 V to 4.2 V. +5V, Description = After the Boost Converter. +3V3, Description = After the Step-Down Converter

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.3.1 Robot's Battery
Alvik is powered by a single 18650 Li-Ion Battery protected by a battery cover at the bottom of the product which can be opened with a Phillips screwdriver. The battery is designed to be easily replaceable at any time so the robot can be used without interruptions in educational environments.
The main board of the robot incorporates the MAX17332X22 to manage the charge and use of the battery including an overvoltage and reverse-voltage protection LTC4360CSC8-2 chip.
Alvik's Battery Compartment
Note: Do not replace the battery without adult supervision.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.3.2 ON/OFF Power Switch
The power of the robot is located by a simple ON/OFF switch located on the top of the robot at the low right corner.
Alvik's Power Switch

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.4 Robot Expandability
Alvik is a robot designed to be used in STEAM & Maker environments where openness and wide compatibility with other products and construction systems are key. Thanks to that Alvik's capabilities can be expanded with new sensors and actuators using the additional connectors on its back, and with additional mechanical extensions like Lego® Technic™ pieces or 3D printed/custom made parts. In the following sections we will explain how to expand Alvik's capabilities.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.4.1 Additional Connectors
Alvik has a series of additional connectors to expand its possibilities located at the back of the robot:
Qwiic Connector (x2), Information = I2C Connectivity with compatible sensors and actuators using the Qwiic estandard. I2C Grove Connector (x2), Information = I2C Connectivity with compatible sensors and actuators using the Grove estandard. PWMServomotor Control (x2), Information = 3-pins Servo Motor connector compatible with a wide ranger of 3rd party manufacturers
Note: When connecting additional hardware to Alvik's connector, make sure each of the components connected has a unique I2C address to avoid connectivity issues.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.4.2 Lego® Technic™ Compatibility
The robot is compatible with Lego® Technic™ pins to expand its body with new features and additional mechanisms.
Lego® Technic™ Compatibility
To attach Lego® Technic™ pieces to Alvik's body use the widely available Lego® Technic™ Pegs. There are two Lego's compatible peg holes on each side of the robot as can be seen in the following image:

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

2.4.3 M3 Screw Inserters Compatibility
Alvik can be expanded with any additional hardware and pieces thanks to its four screw inserts present on each side of the robot. These inserts are compatible with M3 screws being the best way to expand the robot's possibilities using custom made or third-party pieces.
M3 Screws and Lego® Technic™ Peg Holes compatibility
Warning: The maximum screw length recommended is 10 mm (M3x10 ). In case longer screws are used the robot could be damaged.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

3.1 Getting Started - MicroPython
Alvik can be programmed with MicroPython. To do that download and install the Arduino Lab for MicroPython [1] . To connect the Alvik robot to your computer, you will need a USB-C® cable.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

3.2 Getting Started - Arduino IDE
If you want to program your Alvik robot while offline you need to install the Arduino® Desktop IDE [2] . To connect the Alvik robot to your computer, you will need a USB-C® cable.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

3.3 Getting Started - Arduino Cloud
All Arduino® IoT-enabled products are supported on Arduino Cloud [3] which allows you to log, graph and analyze sensor data, trigger events, and automate your home or business.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

3.4 Sample Sketches
Sample sketches for the Alvik robot can be found in the 'Alvik robot Documentation' section of Arduino® Docs [4] and inside its dedicated libraries.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

3.5 Online Resources
Now that you have gone through the basics of what you can do with the device, you can explore the endless possibilities it provides by checking exciting projects on Arduino Project Hub [5] and the online store [6] where you will be able to complement your Alvik robot product with additional extensions, sensors and actuators.

[Product: Alvik] [Category: Education]

5 Laser Safety Information
This product contains a laser emitter and corresponding drive circuitry. The laser output is designed to meet Class 1 laser safety limits under all reasonably foreseeable conditions including single faults, in compliance with IEC 60825-1:2014 . Do not increase the laser output power by any means. Do not use any optics to focus the laser beam. Caution:
Use of controls or adjustments, or performance of procedures other than those specified herein may result in hazardous radiation exposure.
